title: Drawing, Plate Design:  Le Taureau [The Bull], from the Le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service, 1824
title_raw: Plate Design:  Le Taureau [The Bull], from the Le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service
medium: pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, pink/tan watercolor, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on cream laid paper, mounted on cream laid paper, ruled border in pen and brown ink
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and brown ink over graphite, on support, above image:  Le Taureau; below image:  passez-passez q'ny pu d'entans!/allez filles/ça ne vous regarde pas [pass, pass/go quickly/ it's none of your business]; in graphite, upper right corner of mount:  4
description: Scene in front of a stone barn.  A woman with trasied hands, center foreground, shields two young girls from two bulls, left middleground, who appear to be tethered to the stone structure.  A bucket and herding stick lies on the ground, center middleground.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, Plate Design:  Le Taureau [The Bull], from the Le Zodiac Travesti [The Farcical Zodiac] Service, 1824. pen and brown ink, brush and brown wash, pink/tan watercolor, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on cream laid paper, mounted on cream laid paper, ruled border in pen and brown ink. 1989-13-38.
